data.title: Hanover® Architectural Products
data.meta_description: Building relationships and nurturing ideas are a priority; working together to create beautifully designed products for projects of distinction.
data.text:
Ensuring a smooth production process from start to finish, Joe is Hanover’s Texturizing Coordinator. He was born and raised in Hanover, PA and attended New Oxford High School. With over 19 years of experience, Joe began working at the plant in 2001, fulfilling multiple positions from loading trucks to operating a press before transitioning to Production Coordinator in March of 2019, then Texturizing Coordinator in 2022. Joe’s background and knowledge of the manufacturing process allow him to act as a liaison, keeping a constant line of communication flowing between the Sales Team and Plant Managers.

Joe enjoys spending time with his family - his wife Angela, 2 sons, and 1 grandson. Joe is an animal lover having 4 pets currently (2 dogs and 2 cats!). When Joe isn’t spending time on home improvement projects, he likes to go fishing or play golf.

Beginning her career at Hanover® in 2005, Laura Chaney is the Technical Sales Director for the Southeast Region. Born in Baltimore and raised in Carroll county, Laura then graduated from Delone Catholic and has built up 15+ years of experience since her establishment at Hanover® Architectural Products.

You can find Laura spending her free time boating on the Chesapeake or volunteering with various shelters and charities. Laura also works with Operation Gratitude, coordinating donations for our troops. One of Laura’s career highlights, and her favorite project so far, is Denver’s historic Union Station - which was enhanced with an impressive amount of Prest® Brick!

Beginning her career with Hanover® in 2013, Yolanda currently works as Administrative Support. Born and raised in the Philadelphia area, she attended of Little Flower Catholic High School for Girls and Temple University where she studied languages. She handles a multitude of tasks from filing and phone support to assisting our account receivable / account payable team, taking pride in supporting the administrative staff as well. Her favorite part of the job is the daily diversity and interaction with each member of the administrative team.

Yolanda spends time taking care of her 2 children, alongside her husband of 15 years, Hector. Together they enjoy gardening, growing vegetables for use in Yolanda’s creative vegetarian dishes. She also enjoys reading and crocheting.

Makenzie began her career with Hanover® in June of 2022, taking on the role of Regional Sales Support. Born in Annapolis, MD, she was raised in the Gettysburg area and graduated from Littlestown High School in 2010. Bringing with her sales and customer service experience, she currently handles a multitude of tasks from entering quotes and orders to coordinating sample requests, taking pride in supporting the sales staff. Her favorite part of the job thus far is quote creation!

McKenzie spends most of her time outside of work with her husband John and their two children, Jace and Allie. Together, they enjoy family hikes and park trips when the weather fits. She also considers herself to be an avid reader, taking a good book over the TV any day.

Rick has been an integral part of the Hanover® team for over 25 years. Previously, he worked on our Dealer Representative Team, building relationships with our product suppliers throughout the United States. Working towards retirement, he decided to take his knowledge to a support role for our sales team. Bringing with him sales and customer service experience, he currently handles a multitude of tasks from entering quotes and orders to coordinating sample requests, taking pride in supporting the sales staff.

Before joining the team, Rick attended York College to study Police Science and Criminology. Soon afterwards, he joined the police force before making his way in to our sales department here at Hanover®. He has been married to his wife, Vicki, for over 45 years and they have two children together. In his free time, he primarily enjoys golfing.

Tyler joined the Hanover® team in May of 2021. Born and raised in Gettysburg, PA, he pursued an interest in architecture at Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology in Lancaster, PA. He became an integral part of the team not soon after, putting his Architectural knowledge and CAD skills to the test. Alongside Alex, he helps to provide Hanover's Roof & Plaza Layout Assistant service. Working with our sales department and clients, Tyler aims to provide realistic renderings to Hanover's clients, allowing for the calculations on product quanitites, as well as recommended placement. His favorite project to-date includes Fort Knox.

Tyler grew up an Eagle Scout, however these days he spends his spare time fishing and rooting for the Steelers. He also enjoys quality time with friends, family, their pet dog, Tucker, and two cats, Jedi and Baby.

Cory began working here in 2022 as a Web Designer. Born in Westminster, MD, he later moved to Hanover, PA where he earned his diploma at South Western High School. Afterwards, he studied at both Southern New Hampshire University and General Assembly with focuses in software development, web design, and communications. As the web designer, Cory is responsible for maintaining the various websites under the Hanover® umbrella. Beyond that, Cory works alongside the marketing team on various tasks, ranging from ad creation and video editing to resource management and social brainstorming.

Cory spends most of his time with family, friends, and his two cats, Cerce and Apollo. You can also find him volunteering at the Gettysburg Community Theatre in his free time.

Our largest Customer Representative Team, the Northeast, is comprised of 5 members: Ciera, Maresa, Kayla, Nathan, and Steve. The team works together closely with a combination of decades of experience, many of whom were born and raised here in Hanover, PA. With an impressive range of skills, all team members possess a high level of flexibility and the ability to multitask in order to field the variety of calls they receive each day. The team stays fluid, answering various product and project-related questions and generating quotes and orders while coordinating trucks and following production progress. They thoroughly enjoy building lasting relationships with their customers from some of the largest cities in the United States, including New York and Boston.

Nathan and Ciera share a similar educational background with a focus on Business Management while Kayla studied Emergency Management at Millersville University. Nathan’s evenings are often spent coaching soccer while Ciera typically spends time with her family, boyfriend, and two dogs, Sadie and Dixie. Kayla typically fills her excess time with family as well, spending her spare moments with her husband and two children, Nadine and James. Maresa, Steve, Kayla, and Ciera share a love for reading, while the entirety of the team loves everything from cooking and smoking meats to enjoying the outdoors with friends and family.

Debbie and Kerry (left to right) make up our Order Processing team here at Hanover®. They support the sales staff by processing orders, researching project details and verifying customer information. The team also helps answer incoming phone calls, backing up the receptionist. They enjoy processing orders for projects located in unique locations and the satisfaction of seeing completed projects.

Debbie was born in Trinidad and Tobago, moving to this area in 1995 and attending Carroll County Community College. She's been married for 16 years, has one daughter, and two cats, Mocha and David Bowie. In her free time, she spends time with family or volunteers at the PTA. Kerry was born and raised in the Hanover/Gettysburg area, graduating from New Oxford high school. She spends most of her time with her family at home and enjoys watching nostalgic shows such as 'Home Improvement' in her free time.

Having begun his career with Hanover® in 2019 working with our Retail team, Lucas is currently in charge of managing inventory as well as scheduling production. He was born and raised in the Gettysburg area and graduated from Delone Catholic High School in 2015. After high school, Lucas pursued higher education at Penn State Mont Alto with a focus on business management and marketing. Here at Hanover®, he applies what he learned on a daily basis by managing supply chain constraints, providing inventory management / adjustments, and putting together the puzzle pieces that accompany production scheduling.

At home his time is usually spend with his fiancé Jessica and two girls, Maelynn and Tinleigh. They’re also joined by their 3 rescue dogs and a small flock of chickens. In his free time, he coaches wrestling for Delone, enjoys hunting and fishing, and is currently working on building an authentic, historically-accurate Revolutionary War rifle.

Born and raised in Hanover, Danielle manages our Human Resource department here at Hanover®. As our Human Resources representative, Danielle's priorities include recruiting, interviewing, hiring, and managing employee benefits and relations.

Danielle graduated from South Western School District and attended college at Lock Haven University, going into education as a Physical Education teacher for 5 years before joining the team. When she's not in the office, she enjoys exercising, sports, landscaping/gardening, and investing a majority of her free time into her son, whether it's his sporting events, travel desinations, or simply spending time together at home.

Starting her career at Hanover® in 2012 as a Customer Service representative, Aislinn VonSas is the Technical Sales Director for the Northeast Region. Born and raised in Hanover, she attended Southwest High School, moving on to obtain a BA in History at Shippensburg University. Very detail oriented, Aislinn takes pride in seeing orders through from start to finish, tracking order progress and communicating the status to customers on a regular basis. She especially enjoys customer interaction and building relationships.

Aislinn loves spending time with husband of 11 years, Matt, their 3 sons, and their dog, Dezi. She also enjoys spending time with her large family and helping out her grandparents. As a mom of 3 active boys, a lot of her time is spent at sporting events, mainly baseball, but when time allows, Aislinn likes to try out new cooking recipes or take motorcycle trips with her husband.
